name: The Great Garbage Wave
description: In the second half of the 19th century, painters like Monet, Bracquemond, Degas, Manet, Van Gogh... were influenced by packaging that were wrapping objects from Japan, found in department stores. These packaging were prints by anonymous artists of the Land of the Rising Sun and they influenced these painters to the point of revisiting the codes of Western painting. The Great Garbage Wave is a collapsologist AI remix of Hokusai’s Great Wave off Kanagawa (1831) with the Great Pacific Garbage Patch
